page.title: 13Sandridgebury Farm & stables
page.content: Sandridgebury farm is the smallest farm in the area in all 230 acres.The land used to belong to Earl Spencer.On the farm the farmer uses a plough, two tractors, an old combine harvester, a sprayer and a seed planter.When the farmers father died 5 people worked on the farm. Until recently he was there on his own but now he has a helper who is working for 5 months on a youth training schene. Sandridgebury farm is an arable farm. The farmer also owns Sandridgebury Stables and 75% of his money comes from farming and the other 25% was from the stables. On his farm he grows winter barley, winter wheat and oilseed rape, next year he is going to grow peas for protein. As the EEC quota system is limiting their production,the farmer thinks in future they will have to provide leisure activities such as riding stables.
